content: <xml>   <records>        <record>       <contributors>         <authors>           <author>Baig, Roger</author>           <author>Vilalta, Ivan</author>           <author>Neumann, Axel</author>           <author>Aymerich, Marc</author>           <author>Lopez, Ester</author>           <author>Vega, Davide</author>           <author>Meseguer, Roc</author>           <author>Freitag, Felix</author>           <author>Navarro, Leandro</author>           <author>Estrich, Pau</author>         </authors>       </contributors>       <titles>         <title>Community Home Gateways for P2P Clouds</title>         <secondary-title/>       </titles>       <doi>10.1109/P2P.2013.6688732</doi>       <pages/>       <volume/>       <number/>       <keywords>         <keyword>P2P services, home gateways, community networks</keyword>       </keywords>       <dates>         <year>2013</year>         <pub-dates>           <date>2013-09-11</date>         </pub-dates>       </dates>       <abstract><p>P2P based clouds built with low-end devices and voluntarily contributed resources have been proposed by several authors. While some work was published on architectures and decentralized P2P-based mechanisms for such clouds, yet no complete system has been presented which implements such cloud systems without important limitations. We present the community home gateway, a computer system attached to a wireless community network router, able to host platform and application services. Different to current home gateways and other low-end systems, the community home gateway offers resource virtualization, and can thus be used as cloud resource. The community home gateway removes the lack of a system open for service contributions and therefore constitutes an important step towards building P2P clouds with low-end devices. While we present the community home gateway as being part of a P2P community cloud, the applications scenarios of the system that can be imagined go beyond community networks.</p></abstract>     </record>      </records> </xml>
